snippet: The decision would take the military campaign against the Sunni militant group into new and unpredictable terrain.
abstract: Pres Obama is prepared to authorize airstrikes in Syria, taking military campaign against Sunni militant group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria into new and unpredictable terrain; Obama is still wrestling with series of challenges, including how to train and equip ground forces to fight ISIS inside Syria, how to intervene without aiding Pres Bashar al-Assad and how to enlist partners like Turkey and Saudi Arabia.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: The decision would take the military campaign against the Sunni militant group into new and unpredictable terrain.

headline.main: Obama Ready to Authorize Airstrikes on ISIS in Syria
headline.print_headline: Obama Is Ready to Order Strikes From Air in Syria

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
